body:
### Problem

Neovim sometimes crashes when opening the lazy.nvim plugin panel/window with error code 134 and the following error message: `nvim: /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/grid.c:311: grid_line_start: Assertion 'grid_line_row == -1' failed.`

### Steps to reproduce

:Lazy

### Expected behavior

no crash

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.10.0-dev-9afbfb4 Build type: RelWithDebInfo LuaJIT 2.1.1695653777 Run "nvim -V1 -v" for more info

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

Arch btw.

### Terminal name/version

alacritty 0.12.2 (9d9982df)

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

bob

comment_data.body: My config can be found here: https://github.com/paulfrische/.dotfiles/tree/main/nvim/.config/nvim
We need a minimal config to test with; preparing that will help you pin down when the error happens.
Please check if the crash happens on latest commit. Having a stacktrace will also help. https://github.com/neovim/neovim/wiki/FAQ#backtrace-linux

I have the same issue. On latest nightly installed via bob.

Here is a backtrace, but I am not sure how useful it will be: [bt.txt](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/files/12781664/bt.txt)
Same problem. If this helps, disabling the [noice](https://github.com/folke/noice.nvim) plugin will stop the crashes.
Doesn't noice use FFI? That is not supported.

> Doesn't noice use FFI? That is not supported.

It's not because I use `ffi` in `noice.nvim` that all segfaults in Neovim + Noice should be ignored.
I'm pretty confident this issue is not due to `ffi`, but related to `vim.ui_attach`.

(I don't get segfaults btw)

I also have faced this issue for the past few nightly versions. On the LazyVim startup page my shortcut `l` opens the Lazy popup fine, but if I select the entry from the startup page and hit Enter I consistently crash. There is a visible distinction in that with the hotkey I directly get the popover whereas when hitting Enter I get the popover + a floating command line popover(from Noice) and immediately crash.

edit: It also consistently crashes when manually bringing up the floating Noice command line and entering `Lazy`

NVIM v0.10.0-dev-1e7e9ee
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.1695653777


From my CentoOS 7 machine

```

<http://www.gnu.org/software/gdb/bugs/>...

No symbol table info available.

No symbol table info available.

No symbol table info available.
(gdb) quit

``` 

I do also experience this on MacOS but I downgraded to stable in that environment so I don't have any debugging info for that at the moment

I'm willing to see if I can make a work-around, but I need something reproducible.

@haus20xx your steps don't trigger a crash for me. I'm using nightly on Arch.

I just pushed an update to Noice that fixes it in my repro.
When Neovim is blocking, we no longer update the views when the incoming message is `msg_ruler`.

Can you all check if this also fixes the crashes on your end?

Even with this working, there may of course still be an actual bug somewhere in Neovim that may have to be fixed

> I just pushed an update to Noice that fixes it in my repro. When Neovim is blocking, we no longer update the views when the incoming message is `msg_ruler`.
> 
> Can you all check if this also fixes the crashes on your end?
> 
> Even with this working, there may of course still be an actual bug somewhere in Neovim that may have to be fixed

Fedora 38. No crash now.

@folke 
> Can you all check if this also fixes the crashes on your end?

Fedora 38 and Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS working fine for me. 

Thank you!

@folke

My reliable crashes are now working as intended! Thanks :)

> Found another way to rrigger this. Full stacktrace:

Out of curiosity, what was this other way?

I could trigger it with `dashboard.nvim`:

- start neovim with the dashboard
- load session
- open lazy

Same steps, but with mini.starter or alpha.nvim didnt trigger the issue :)

labels.description: waiting for reply from the author
labels.name: needs:response

labels.description: We need minimal steps to reproduce the issue
labels.name: needs:repro

labels.description: issue reporting a crash or segfault
labels.name: bug-crash

title: Assertion error
